sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The level 4 of translations groups together the translations of programs which may output messages to the screen but do not input users.
All internationalized packages which output messages to the screen during first and second stage are considered part of the level 4 of &d-i; localization.

This includes the following Debian packages:
debconf (program)
discover1 (program)
dpkg
apt
shadow (program)
dpkg, apt and shadow programs are very often used during the whole life of a Debian system, so having them translated, though very tedious, is a must-have for a good localized system.
discover1 and debconf outputs messages to the console during &d-i; processes.

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The debconf program is the software which is used for user interaction during Debian packages configuration step. All Debian packages should use debconf when they need user input for installation-time configuration.
debconf may output information to the screen : this is why the program translation is included in &d-i; fourth level of translation.

Debconf also prompts users with questions when installed. However, during a complete &d-i; run, these questions are pre-answered with the similar questions from the cdebconf package (which is part of level 1). As a consequence, the translation of these questions is only part of level 5.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: The package uses a SVN repository. Commit access may be requested to the &i18n-coords;. However, as the translatable parts do not change very often, getting commit access is not highly useful.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the debconf package or committed directly to the SVN repository.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: N/A

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The discover1 program is aimed at automatic recognition of hardware on Debian GNU/Linux systems. It is maintained by the &d-i; team.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: This package is a regular Debian package. The package maintainer team (the &d-i; team) use a SVN repository. The &i18n-coords; handle commits for translations.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the discover1 package.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: N/A

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The dpkg program is a low level program which installs and removes Debian packages.

Including it in &d-i; level 4 of translation is an extension of the scope of &d-i; localization process. dpkg does not output very often during a base system install, but is very likely to be used further, either directly invoked by the system administrator or from another program such as aptitude, apt, or dselect (dselect translations are part of dpkg translations).

dpkg full translation is a huge work because there are hundreds of strings in the POT file. Most of these strings are very short strings and most of them are hard-formatted because they are used from a command-line program.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: This package is a regular Debian package. The package maintenance team uses arch repositories to maintain it.
As arch-style repositories are somewhat complicated to setup, all localization of dpkg is handled by one of the &i18n-coords;.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the dpkg package.

The translation will be committed quickly by the dpkg localization maintainer. This will not appear immediately on status pages because dpkg development is handled in arch repositories which are not easily handled by the scripts which generate the status pages.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: Undoubtfully, dpkg translation requires a good knowledge of the Debian package management system as well as some good experience of command-line programs translation.
The developers have put comments targeted at translators for some strings. Translators should read and follow them carefully.

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The apt program handles installation and removal of Debian packages from packages sources such as Debian HTTP/FTP mirrors, Debian CD's, third party CD's or repositories, or local files.

Including it in &d-i; level 4 of translation is an extension of the scope of &d-i; localization process. apt does not output very often during a base system install, but is very likely to be used further.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: This package is a regular Debian package. The package maintenance team uses arch repositories to maintain it.
As arch-style repositories are somewhat complicated to setup, all localization of apt is handled by one of the &i18n-coords;.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the apt package.

The translation will be committed quickly by the dpkg localization maintainer. This will not appear immediately on status pages because apt development is handled in arch repositories which are not easily handled by the scripts which generate the status pages.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: apt full translation is a huge work because there are hundreds of strings in the POT file. Most of these strings are short strings and most of them are hard-formatted because they are outputted during the use of a command-line program.
Similarly to dpkg, apt translation requires a good knowledge of the Debian package management system as well as some good experience of command-line programs translation.
The developers have put comments targeted at translators for some strings. Translators should read them carefully. Some of them are very important.

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The shadow package has already been mentioned previously in this document as part of the level 2 of translation (see ).

The utilities installed by this package have been internationalized and, as they are core utilities for a Debian system, translating them is important to achieve a good localization of the installed system.

This translation is, like apt and dpkg translations, a program translation : programs (like passwd, chpw, chsh, etc.) output, error and help messages. Such translation is quite tedious and long term work and need some carefulness (respect line breaks, variable substitutions...).

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: This package is a regular Debian package. Programs translations are maintained by the upstream maintainer who uses a CVS repository.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the shadow package. The upstream maintainer will pick them from there.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: Upstream has a monthly release schedule with usually one week string freeze before each release. Call for updates will be sent during this string freeze.
Uploads of the Debian package will occur one or two weeks after upstream has released his new version.
